answers.answer: I also did the hour test and failed it. Then had to go back another day for a 2 hour test. Luckily I passed the second time. Both times I could not eat anthing. To be on the safer side I wouldn't eat anything because they may make you come back another day if you did. I would get ahold of your doctor and find out just to be sure.
With my one hour test I was told to have my normal breakfast then come in for the test.. Just give the place a call and ask them :-)
They said have a lite breakfast but for mine I didn't eat
Mine is a one hour and they told me to eat then wait an hour and go in them take the drink and I'll have to wait an hour

For my hours test, they told me not to eat or drink anything after 12 midnight the day before my test. I wouldn't just to be on the safe side and have to come back another day, but you might just want to call and ask to see if it's ok for you to eat.
I just had my testing done yesterday I had breakfast at around 930am and my test was at 130pm and everything turned out good.
My doctor said I had to go in fasting. Nothing to eat after midnight the day before also.
You need a 10 hour Windows to test. If you eat before your fasting blood will cause you to fail.
I ate eggs before I went in and was fine.
You don't need to fast few doctors make you fat fire the 1 hr test. I have mine on Monday as well. And was told to est a wholesome breakfast low in sugar. Eggs and toast etc
Thank you ladies for your help i think I will call them to be 100%sure

question: I go in for my one hour test Monday and was wondering if I should eat before or not they never told me if I could or not. And even tho I'm a phlebotomy nurse myself my schooling tells me no don't eat but I'm not to sure I'm a lil rusty it's been awhile since I was actually in a lab. What did you mommy's do?
title: gestational diabetes test
